intro: Ferraria framesii, commonly known as the Cape bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its stems are often upright and branched. Ferraria framesii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
